climbs.name: Wing Span
climbs.fa: Chris England and Bruce Rubio, April 2008

content.description: Starts with a delicate lieback and then wanders the face above to a crux top-out.
content.location:
Starts about 15 feet right of the prominent arete which is

Big Bear Roots

.

climbs.name: Konklin Face
climbs.fa: Bruce Rubio, Chris England and Eddie Page, May 2008

content.description:
Short but demanding on the fingers, this steep slab/face will test your footwork and balance as you negotiate the thin crimps and quartz crystals.

* The rating is from the very bottom of the block; if you traverse left into the 2nd bolt it is 5.11d.
content.location:
Located on a short, steep block up and right of

Easy Castle Crack

.

climbs.name: Easy Castle Crack
climbs.fa: Andy Bussell, Eddie Page and Bruce Rubio, May 2008

content.description: Short and uneventful; this will be over far too soon but worth a spin if in the area.
content.location:
Located up and right of

Wing Span

.

content.description:
Scramble up onto a large flat ledge and climb the prominent widening crack in a flared corner. The crack starts off a nice size but at the top you will want a larger piece or two.

As an alternative you can climb the crack start of

Big Bear Roots

to the large ledge which bumps the grade up to 5.10a.
content.location:
Located around and left from

Big Bear Roots

on the northern end of the crag.

climbs.name: Big Bear Roots
climbs.fa: Bruce Rubio and Chris England, April 2008

content.description: Starts in a short bit of crack (crux) and moves along the featured arete with interesting movement.
content.location: The prominent arete on the left side of the west face.
